ðŸ“‹ ENTRY: JazzCash â€“ Customer â€“ Loads and Bundles - SCO 
------------------------------------------------------------
Main Header: DFS
Network Provider: Jazz
Complaint Description: <ul>
	<li>This SOP document will cover scenarios related to load, bundle and postpaid bill of SCO.</li>
	<li>Special Communication Organization (SCO) is a telecommunication service provider which provide services in Azad Jammu &amp; Kashmir and Gilgit Baltistan. SCO is just like other OMNO in Pakistan (Telenor, Ufone, Zong) but most of there presence is in the North region of Pakistan.</li>
	<li>JazzCash customer can now purchase SCO prepaid load, bundle and postpaid bill using Load and bundle menu in JazzCash App.</li>
	<li>SCO load, bundle and Bill payment transaction can be performed despite of the location of the user. SCO SIM user can be anywhere in Pakistan, when a JazzCash customer perform load, bundle or postpaid bill payment transaction, JazzCash account will be debited and SCO user number will be credited or bundle will be subscribed on provided SCO number.
	<ul>
		<li>Minimum Prepaid Load: 50</li>
		<li>&nbsp;Maximum Prepaid Load: 5,000</li>
		<li>Minimum Postpaid Bill: 50</li>
		<li>Minimum Postpaid Bill: 15,000</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
	<li>In CPS, SCO load and bundles will be shown with respective reason type.</li>
</ul>

<ol>
	<li>SCO Prepaid Load - Reason Type: Customer Buys SCOM Prepaid Load via App</li>
	<li>SCO Bundle - Reason Type: Customer Buys SCOM Bundles via App</li>
	<li>SCO Postpaid Bill - Reason Type: Customer Buys SCOM Postpaid Load via App</li>
</ol>

<p><strong>Special information about SCO Bundles:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>SCO Bundles available in JazzCash are designed according to regions (Azad Jammu &amp; Kashmir, Gilgit Baltistan).</li>
	<li>Region is mentioned after the name of every bundle. Customer can only subscribe bundle for respective region if the SCO SIM belongs to those particular regions.</li>
	<li>Gilgit Baltistan bundles will only be subscribed on Gilgit Baltistan SCO number and Azad Jammu &amp; Kashmir bundles will only be subscribed on Azad Jammu &amp; Kashmir SCO number.</li>
	<li>If a customer has Azad Jammu &amp; Kashmir SCO SIM, a Gilgit Baltistan bundle will not be subscribed and will give error while entering MSISDN. Error: Invalid Gilgit Baltistan Number.</li>
	<li>Below is the list of prefixes for SCO numbers.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Azad Jammu &amp; Kashmir Number series</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>3556XXXXXX</li>
	<li>3557XXXXXX</li>
	<li>3558XXXXXX</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Gilgit Baltistan Number series</strong></p>

<ol>
	<li>3554XXXXXX</li>
	<li>3555XXXXXX</li>
</ol>

<ul>
	<li>If a customer calls and complains that he/she is unable to subscribe bundles please guide them about the regional check. For clarity, below are the list of bundles that are available for Azad Jammu &amp; Kashmir and Gilgit Baltistan.</li>
</ul>

<table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width:564px">
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td colspan="8">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Azad Jammu &amp; Kashmir Bundles</strong></p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td rowspan="2">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Package</strong></p>
			</td>
			<td colspan="4">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Resources</strong></p>
			</td>
			<td rowspan="2">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Validity</strong></p>
			</td>
			<td rowspan="2">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Package Code</strong></p>
			</td>
			<td rowspan="2">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Price (Incl Tax)</strong></p>
			</td>
		</tr>

<p><span style="color:#e74c3c"><strong>Info Scenario</strong></span></p>

<table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width:606px">
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Scenario 1. SCO &ndash; Information Scenarios</strong></p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Information Work Codes</strong></p>

ðŸ“‹ ENTRY: JazzCash â€“ Merchant â€“ Unikrew 
------------------------------------------------------------
Main Header: DFS
Network Provider: Jazz
Complaint Description: <p><span style="color:#0782c1"><strong>Product/Service Description:</strong></span></p>

<p>&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Merchant Unikrew is an in App BVS feature by which merchant can upgrade/activate/increase limit account in app.</p>

<ul>
	<li>Merchant can open M1 Account directly</li>
	<li>Merchant can upgrade account from M0 to M1 (Limit Increase as well).</li>
	<li>Merchant account suspended due to non BVS can be activated.</li>
</ul>

<p>&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Merchant need to allow permission of business app from mobile app setting such as (Camera). &nbsp;<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Merchant can perform in JazzCash Business App BVS by scanning both hands.<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Merchant will scan first left hand than right hand.<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Merchant perform in app BVS can be performed twice.<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Merchant can scan hands once in 24 hours from JazzCash Business App.<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;After 24 hours Merchant can try once more. After two successful attempts but still merchant account is not activated or limit is not increased then inform merchant to visit nearest BVS enable Retailer, Franchise, Experience Centre and respective Work Code will be punched. Please refer to Limit Exhaust work code in Work code header. &nbsp;<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Merchant cannot perform more than two time in Unikrew.<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Merchant account M0 non BVS in 90 days account got suspended can be activated via app.<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Merchant registration of account from JazzCash Business App during registration request merchant can perform in App BVS. Once registration of account is successful then merchant account level will be M1.&nbsp;<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Merchant account limit and account level will increase from M0 to M1 through in App BVS (Unikrew). Limit will increase within 5 minutes.&nbsp;<br />
&nbsp;</p>

ðŸ“‹ ENTRY: JazzCash â€“ Merchant â€“ Schedule Settlement 
------------------------------------------------------------
Main Header: DFS
Network Provider: Jazz
Complaint Description: <p><strong>Product / Service Description: &nbsp; &nbsp;</strong><br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Schedule settlement is a new service introduced for JazzCash Merchants.<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Merchant will be able to settle now or schedule the settlement for later as per their business needs.<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Multiple banks account can be added in schedule settlement.<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Merchant can add 3 schedule settlements.<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Merchant can add 3 bank accounts in schedule settlement.<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;You can schedule any payment daily, weekly, bi-weekly and monthly. These payments will keep processing as per the set schedule.<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;The standard fee applicable on IBFT will be applied for scheduled settlements.<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Merchant.<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Merchant can also delete scheduled transaction or any added bank account in schedule settlement.<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;All prevailing merchant transaction and account balance limits will be checked before transaction is approved.<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;In case the account limits are exhausted, schedule settlement transaction will be failed and will not be auto initiated. It will be re-initiated next time as per the scheduled time set by the merchant. &nbsp;<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Merchants will not be able to add the daily settlement amount greater than daily outgoing IBFT limit as per merchant own account limits. If the merchant set up a Settlement transaction with greater limit, transaction will be failed upon execution.&nbsp;<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Merchant can also check transaction history in schedule settlement for all schedule settlement transaction.<br />
&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Business App &gt;&gt; Click Schedule Settlement &gt;&gt; Click Settlement History<br />
&bull;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Merchant can delete any settlement and added bank account by just sweeping lift on the settlement/Bank and delete them.&nbsp;</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p>Please Refer to below table 1.0</p>

<p><strong>Table: 1.0</strong></p>

	<tbody>

			WORLDCALL</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>PTCL LANDLINE<br />
			PTCL VFONE PREPAID</p>

			<p>&nbsp;</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
	</tbody>
</table>

<ul>
	<li>Customer will select desired UBP Company and enter consumer number/reference number and fetch bill amount any pay it after entering MPIN bill will be paid.</li>
	<li>you can add the bills in your list of &ldquo;My favorites&rdquo; by selecting the &ldquo;Add to favourite&rdquo; option at the last step of bill</li>
	<li>You can add maximum 10 utility bills as your favourite</li>
	<li>The character limit for favourite nick name is upto 20</li>
	<li>The maximum limit to pay utility bill via JazzCash is Rs. 150,000/month. This amount can be used either to pay one bill or several bills.</li>
	<li>For K-electric and PTCL complaint TAT will be 4 working days and for all other UBP company&rsquo;s complaint TAT will be 1 working Day</li>
	<li>Customer can pay bill via app by entering Reference Number or Scanning Barcode.</li>
	<li>The scanner can be used to either scan a barcode through your phones camera or selecting an image from your gallery. Paying utility bills has never been this easy through your JazzCash app.</li>
	<li>Most of the electricity companies and gas companies allow for barcode scanning of their respective bills Refer to Table 1.1.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Table 1.1</strong></p>

<table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Electricity</strong></p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Gas</strong></p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>IESCO</p>

			<p>GEPCO</p>

			<p>PESCO</p>

			<p>QESCO</p>

			<p>HESCO</p>

			<p>SEPCO</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center">SNGL<br />
			SSGC</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
	</tbody>
</table>

<ul>
	<li>For all UBP related issue agent must validate customer concern and ask customer UBP Reference number, Amount, Billing Company to ensure customer concern valid for complaint registration</li>
	<li>After validating customer concern and consulting system inform customer as per below scenarios.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Utility Bill Payment &ndash; Bill Paid against Wrong Reference Number:</strong></p>

<p>Customer pay against wrong reference number agent will inform customer that bill is paid and no reversal is possible and inform customer to coordinate with relevant billing company.</p>

<p><strong>Utility Bill Payment &ndash; Unable to Pay Bill:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>If customer is paying bill but is unable to pay bill due to any valid error agent will ask customer whether bill is received in hard copy or not.</li>
	<li>If bill is not received in hard copy agent will inform customer to wait for the bill to be received in hard copy</li>
	<li>If bill is received in hard copy agent will simply forward complaint (Refer to JazzCash &ndash; Customer &ndash; Utility Bill &ndash; Complaint Management)</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Utility Bill Payment &ndash; 2-month Bill Paid </strong></p>

<p>If customer does not pay previous month bill and new bill is received with arrears and current bill is 2-month bill and customer is now paying 2-month bill if customer receives bill in next month with arrears then complaint will be lodged (Refer to JazzCash &ndash; Customer &ndash; Utility Bill &ndash; Complaint)</p>

<p><strong>Utility Bill Payment &ndash; Bill Paid in Due Date:</strong></p>

<p>If customer pay bill in due date and bill is received with arrears next month agent will forward complaint (Refer to JazzCash &ndash; Customer &ndash; Utility Bill &ndash; Complaint)</p>

<p><strong>Utility Bill Payment &ndash; Amount Deducted Twice</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>If customer pay bill and amount is deducted twice inform customer that extra amount will be reversed within 24 hours.</li>
	<li>If amount is not reversed in 24 hours agent will forward complaint (Refer to JazzCash &ndash; Customer &ndash; Utility Bill &ndash; Complaint).</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Utility Bill Payment &ndash; Amount Deducted More Than Bill Amount:</strong></p>

<p>If customer pay bill and amount paid is greater than bill amount inform customer that amount will be adjusted in next bill if not adjusted than proceed with complaint registration (Refer to JazzCash &ndash; Customer &ndash; Utility Bill &ndash; Complaint)</p>

<p><strong>Utility Bill Payment &ndash; Bill Paid After Due Date:</strong></p>

<p>If customer pay bill late (after due date) and transaction is completed and customer is complaining that bill is not updated just inform customer to contact with relevant billing company.</p>

<p><strong>Utility Bill Payment &ndash; Bill Paid Wrong by System Issue:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>If customer calls and say that he was paying current month bill but previous month bill got paid by system issue agent will inform customer that bill amount will be adjusted in next month bill.</li>
	<li>If next month bill is received without adjustment agent will forward complaint registration (Refer to JazzCash &ndash; Customer &ndash; Utility Bill &ndash; Complaint)</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Utility Bill Payment &ndash; Bill Paid Against Two Channel:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>If customer pay bill from any other bank and same bill is paid again from JazzCash, agent will just inform customer that the bill will be adjusted in next month bill</li>
	<li>&nbsp;If customer wants adjustment right now then agent will inform customer to just contact relevant billing company.</li>
	<li>If next month bill is received without adjustment agent will forward complaint registration (Refer to JazzCash &ndash; Customer &ndash; Utility Bill &ndash; Complaint)</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Proof of Utility Bill Payment: &nbsp;</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>Utility Bill was paid but the new bill showing arrears, and billing companies are asking for proof of utility bill payment via JazzCash.</li>
	<li>In case customer came with below complaint provide the below details (mentioned in table) to him/her on call in order to facilitate by checking CPS</li>
	<li>Agent need to request the customer to note down the details carefully and share that with UBP company
	<ul>
		<li>Receipt No.: &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;</li>
		<li>Status: &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;</li>
		<li>Date and time: &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;</li>
		<li>Initiator: &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;</li>
		<li>Credit Party (which is utility bill company): &nbsp; &nbsp;</li>
		<li>Amount Due &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;</li>
		<li>Amount Paid &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;</li>
		<li>Bill reference number</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Charges:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>Rs. 5.00 (Incl. Tax) per bill for first 3 bill</li>
	<li>Rs. 20.00 (Incl. Tax) per bill from 4th bill to 9th bill</li>
	<li>Rs. 30.00 (Incl. Tax) per bill from 10th bill to onward</li>
	<li>Charges as per calendar month</li>
	<li>Refer to Table 1.2 for high level understanding</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Pre-requisite to SOP</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>Verification: L3</li>
	<li>Account status: Active</li>
	<li>Need to validate Billing Company and Bill Reference Number</li>
	<li>Data to be taken from CPS only</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>System Navigation:</strong></p>

<p><strong>Check Account Status</strong>: CPS <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Search MSISDN <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Check Status</p>

<p><strong>Check Transaction History: </strong>CPS <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Search MSISDN <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Click Review Transaction <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Click Transaction</p>

<p><strong>Check Transaction Status: </strong>CPS <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Search MSISDN <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Click Review Transaction <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Click Transaction <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Search transaction as per Date/Time <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Check Status</p>

<p><strong>Check Verification from NADRA Portal</strong>: NADRA Portal &gt;&gt; Search MSISDN &gt;&gt; Enter CNIC and CNIC Issuance Date (Verify from customer) &gt;&gt; Check Verification details</p>

ðŸ“‹ ENTRY: JazzCash â€“ Customer â€“ Email Update 
------------------------------------------------------------
Main Header: DFS
Network Provider: Jazz
Complaint Description: <ul>
	<li>This SOP document will cover scenarios related Account Email.</li>
	<li>Account Email is use to received Statement, alert about transaction and Important Updates regarding to your Account.</li>
	<li>Customer can Email address via USSD and JazzCash App.</li>
	<li>From JazzCash App customer can update email in Profile.</li>
	<li>You will receive real time Notification about transaction and other account activities carried out from account, helping you &nbsp;to stay informed about your account.</li>
	<li>Customer can get account statement via email.</li>
	<li>&nbsp;If the customer already added their email to their account profile, the statement will be sent on that email.</li>
	<li>When making the statement, if the customer wants it sent to a different email, they can enter that email during statement generation request and the statement will be sent on provided email.</li>
	<li>Agent will inform customer the complete How &ndash; to Processes and sent relevant <strong>ISMS</strong>. if customer insists then agent will forward service request (Refer to Service Request Scenario)</li>
</ul>

ID: 15970

ðŸ“‹ ENTRY: JazzCash â€“ Customer â€“ Money Transfer â€“ DR Reversal, DR Receiver CNIC Edit 
------------------------------------------------------------
Main Header: DFS
Network Provider: Jazz
Complaint Description: <ul>
	<li>This SOP document will cover scenarios related amount sent on CNIC via JazzCash (Domestic Remittance - DR).</li>
	<li>Customer can send or receive amount on valid CNIC and can withdraw amount from BVS enable retailers and franchises. DR cannot be sent on expired CNIC.</li>
	<li>DR Reversal means when a customer wanted to reverse the amount which he/she sent from his/her JazzCash account to any customer CNIC.</li>
	<li>DR Receiver CNIC Edit means when a customer wanted to edit (change) Receiver&rsquo;s CNIC on which amount is sent at the time of transaction initiation.</li>
	<li>DR Reversal and DR Receiver CNIC Edit requests can only be submitted if the transaction is still available and have not been collected by the receiver.</li>
	<li>Customer can also get CNIC edit on which Dr transaction is performed from any BVS Retailer by providing Transaction ID and BVS verification.</li>
	<li>Customer can send maximum of Rs: 25,000 on a CNIC in one go.</li>
	<li>The receiving customer must collect the transaction within 180 days. As per regulations, all transaction uncollected for longer than 180 days will be blocked. This transaction cannot be reversed nor edit receiver CNIC.</li>
	<li>Amount sent on CNIC has service charges. Either sender can pay the charges on sending amount on CNIC if sender does not pay then receiver while withdrawing amount from retailer or franchise will be charged for that specific amount.</li>
	<li>Charges on transferring amount on CNIC are below</li>
</ul>

<table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
	<tbody>
		<tr>

<p><strong>System Navigation:</strong></p>

<p><strong>Check Account Status</strong>: CPS <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Search MSISDN <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Check Status</p>

<p><strong>Check Transaction History: </strong>CPS <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Search MSISDN <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Click Operations <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Click Transaction History</p>

<p><strong>Check Transaction Status: </strong>CPS <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Search MSISDN <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Click Operations <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Click Transaction history <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Search transaction as per Date/Time <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Check Status</p>

<p><strong>Check Verification from NADRA Portal: </strong>NADRA Portal <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Search MSISDN <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Enter CNIC and CNIC Issuance Date (Verify from the customer) <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Check Verification details</p>

<p><strong>Check Receiver CNIC in G2P/P2P</strong>: CPS &gt;&gt; My Functions &gt;&gt; Operations &gt;&gt; G2P/P2P Payment Management &gt;&gt; Search Receiver CNIC</p>

ðŸ“‹ ENTRY: JazzCash â€“ Customer - ReadyCash 
------------------------------------------------------------
Main Header: DFS
Network Provider: Jazz
Complaint Description: <p><strong>Product / Service Description: </strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>

<ul>
	<li>ReadyCash is an instant loan service for JazzCash Mobile Account customers to avail short-term loans of small denominations through JazzCash App or USSD.</li>
	<li>ReadyCash service will credit loan into customer&rsquo;s account allowing them to utilize the amount instantly to meet short-term loan requirement.</li>
	<li>Customers can avail ReadyCash service for a duration of four weeks; with the option to pay back early as well.</li>
	<li>Customer can only get one loan of up to Rs 20,000 at a time. Loan amount depends on loan eligibility.</li>
	<li>If customer is requesting Loan Amount of more than 10,000 Rs., customer will be asked to enter &quot;Purpose&quot; of taking loan as additional information. Customer can select purpose from 3 pre-defined options.</li>
	<li>Customer will have to pay weekly charges of ReadyCash loan facility, over and above the loan amount.</li>
	<li>Account closure and change of MSISDN cannot be performed on customer account if there is any outstanding Ready Cash loan amount.</li>
	<li>Loan Status is updated within 12 working hours. If customers complains that their loan status is not updated after performing transaction (applying for loan or repayment of loan), ask them to wait for 12 working hours and loan status will be updated. If issue persists, proceed with making relevant complaint.
	<p><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif"><strong>WorkCode: </strong><span dir="ltr" lang="en-PK" style="color:black">ReadyCash Loan Status Not Updated in CPS - Complaint Not Lodged</span></span></span></p>

	<p><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif"><strong>WorkCode: </strong><span dir="ltr" lang="en-PK" style="color:black">ReadyCash Loan Status Not Updated in ReadyCash Portal - Complaint Not Lodged</span></span></span></p>
	&nbsp;</li>
	<li>If customer is unable to take loan due to Purpose of Loan, ask customer to try again after Clearing the App cache and updating the Application. If customer is still unable to perform transaction, please proceed with complaint. &nbsp;</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>ReadyCash Loan Eligibility: &nbsp;</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>Service is available for eligible customer only.</li>
	<li>Customer can self-check using USSD and App. If customer is not eligible for the ReadyCash loan, he/she will receive notification/SMS that he/she is not eligible. (refer to Scenario 2)</li>
	<li>Eligibility is auto set by Backend system accordingly to customer profile and JazzCash services usage.</li>
	<li>Eligibility cannot be changed/altered manually.</li>
	<li>Agent will check ReadyCash portal and confirm customer the amount he/she is eligibile for. Refer to scenario 2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>ReadyCash Loan Payment:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>Customer will have to pay weekly charges of 5% of loan amount, over and above the loan amount. 5% charges will be on principle amount</li>
	<li>Customer can deposit amount repayable or more into their JazzCash mobile account before the due date for an automatic repayment (Auto Debit). Auto debit will run next day of Loan due date.</li>
	<li>Customers must pay back their loan within 4 weeks. In case their repayment is late, JazzCash will automatically extend their due date by a week (up to maximum of 4 weeks).</li>
	<li>Customer can deposit amount repayable or more into their JazzCash mobile account before the due date for an automatic repayment (Auto Debit). Auto Debit will run on the 29th Day of loan issuance.</li>
	<li>Customer can repay full as well as partial loan amount.</li>
	<li>If customer still does not repay the ReadyCash loan in full, they will be blacklisted from availing ReadyCash service in future and will also be reported as a defaulter to the State Bank of Pakistan.</li>
	<li>Remaining loan amount is less than Rs 1 (Decimals) need to inform customer that he/she can make ReadyCash full repayment option through USSD only. Refer to How to Processes 2.3</li>
	<li>Please refer to below table 1.0 for high level product details&nbsp;</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Pre-requisite to SOP</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>Verification: L3</li>
	<li>Account status: Active</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>System Navigation for Agent: </strong></p>

<p><strong>To check Account Status:</strong> CPS &gt;&gt; Search MSISDN &gt;&gt; Check Status</p>

<p><strong>To check Transaction History:</strong> CPS &gt;&gt; Search MSISDN &gt;&gt; Click Operation &gt;&gt; Click Transaction history &gt;&gt; Check Transaction</p>

<p><strong>To check Transaction Failure Reason:</strong> CPS &gt;&gt; Search MSISDN &gt;&gt; Click Operation &gt;&gt; Click Transaction history &gt;&gt; Check Transaction &gt;&gt; transaction Details &gt;&gt; Failure Description</p>

<p><strong>To Check Ready Cash Loan Eligibility via Ready Cash Portal:</strong> KMS &gt;&gt; Quick Links &gt;&gt; ReadyCash Portal &gt;&gt; Search MSISDN (Start with 92xxxxxxxxxx) &gt;&gt; Check Eligibility</p>

<p><strong>To Check Ready Cash Loan Amount via Ready Cash Portal:</strong> KMS &gt;&gt; Quick Links &gt;&gt; ReadyCash Portal &gt;&gt; Search MSISDN &gt;&gt; Check Pending Amount</p>

Submission Channel: 3073,34

ðŸ“‹ ENTRY: JazzCash â€“ Merchant â€“ Request To Pay 
------------------------------------------------------------
Main Header: DFS
Network Provider: Jazz
Complaint Description: <ul>
	<li>This SOP document will cover scenarios related to Request to Pay.</li>
	<li>JazzCash Business app currently offers Request to Pay (Get Payments) feature which allows merchant to send payment requests to their customers. Customers can approve these requests and pay either through QR or in-app payment method.</li>
	<li>In request to pay merchant will generate Dynamic QR.</li>
	<li>Request via wallet is a quick way to get your payment from the payer. As soon as you send the request, it popups up on their app or USSD. The payer just needs to enter the MPIN within 30 secs for the payment to complete</li>
	<li>The request will land on USSD if the payer is a Jazz user, and as an in-app popup if the user has any of the other networks.</li>
	<li>When popup appears, customer need to enter Account MPIN and transaction will be processed.</li>
	<li>Merchant can also generate invoices for payment in Request to Pay option where he will add product name and amount and generate invoice.</li>
	<li>Merchant can add more than one product in one invoice.</li>
	<li>When merchant is generating invoice, he can also add Tax Percentage(optional) and discount offer on invoice(optional).</li>
	<li>These discount and tax percentage will be optional if merchant doesn&rsquo;t want to add them they can easily skip them by not adding them just.</li>
	<li>That Tax percentage and discount offer will be flat or percentage vise.</li>
	<li>Merchant can also add description in Quick Payment and also document/image can be attached.</li>
	<li>Merchant will be able to perform transaction Via Quick Payment on Recipient MSISDN OR Email.</li>
	<li>Customer will click view request in Payment Request Tab</li>
	<li>Successfully completed requests will show up in transaction history only, and not in the view requests section</li>
	<li>Completed requests will not show Payment Request Tab, they will move to transaction history.</li>
	<li>Only pending/declined request will be shown in Payment Request Tab.</li>
	<li>Please refer to table 1.0 for high level information</li>
</ul>

<p>Table 1.0</p>

ðŸ“‹ ENTRY: JazzCash â€“ Merchant â€“ Account Statement 
------------------------------------------------------------
Main Header: DFS
Network Provider: Jazz
Complaint Description: <p><strong>Product / Service Description: </strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>

<ul>
	<li>JazzCash Business Account statement is a document that covers all the activity of your account.</li>
	<li>Statement includes all transaction details and balance of JazzCash Business account which is sent or received in JazzCash Business account.</li>
	<li>Account statement includes all completed credit and debit transaction details.</li>
	<li>For account statement merchant must have a valid email address so that he can receive Account Statement.</li>
	<li>Statement will receive on existing Email of merchant account</li>
	<li>If merchant email is not updated in JazzCash Business Account need to inform merchant update email process.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; For USSD:</strong></p>

<p>*800# &gt;&gt; 5 Click My Account &gt;&gt; Click Update Email &gt;&gt; Enter Email &gt;&gt; Confirm with MPIN</p>

<p><strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; For JazzCash Business APP:</strong></p>

<p>JazzCash Business App &gt;&gt; Click Profile &gt;&gt; Click Edit In front of Email option&gt;&gt; Enter New Email &gt;&gt; Click Continue</p>

<ul>
	<li>If merchant want to get account statement agent will inform merchant the complete process of statement according to merchant requirement along with sending relevant <strong>ISMS.</strong></li>
	<li>Account statement can be checked from USSD and JazzCash Business app.</li>
	<li>There are two mediums by which merchant can check account statement.
	<ul>
		<li>&nbsp;USSD</li>
		<li>JazzCash Business App</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>USSD:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>Merchant can get account statement via USSD.</li>
	<li>By SMS last 5 complete transaction perform in last 7 days can be checked via USSD.</li>
	<li>By email merchant can check Account Statement last 30 days.</li>
	<li>Statement through email via USSD merchant will be able to check 30 days or less than 30 detail at a time.</li>
	<li>Merchant will not be able check account statement more than last 30 days via USSD.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>JazzCash Business App:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>Merchant can get account statement via JazzCash Business app.</li>
	<li>In Transaction History Tab last 20 Transactions will shown.</li>
	<li>Transaction will be updated within 2 hours in Account Statement and Transaction History Tab.</li>
	<li>From JazzCash Business App merchant can check 1 Year statement in one go on Email through Transaction History Tab or Account Statement Tab.</li>
	<li>Merchant can manually enter start date and end date to get a specific duration account statement.</li>
	<li>Merchant can also get statement by pre-define options in Account Statement Tab.</li>
	<li>Merchant will not be able check account statement more than last 30 days via USSD.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>JazzCash Business App:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>Merchant can get account statement via JazzCash Business app.</li>
	<li>In Transaction History Tab last 20 Transactions will shown.</li>
	<li>Transaction will be updated within 2 hours in Account Statement and Transaction History Tab.</li>
	<li>From JazzCash Business App merchant can check 1 Year statement in one go on Email through Transaction History Tab or Account Statement Tab.</li>
	<li>Merchant can manually enter start date and end date to get a specific duration account statement.</li>
	<li>Merchant can also get statement by pre-define options in Account Statement Tab.</li>
</ul>

ðŸ“‹ ENTRY: JazzCash â€“ Merchant - Deposit via Debit Card 
------------------------------------------------------------
Main Header: DFS
Network Provider: Jazz
Complaint Description: <ul>
	<li>&nbsp;JazzCash merchant can deposit amount directly in their JazzCash account via Debit Card of any Bank.</li>
	<li>Card information is saved by default for future use after performing a successful Deposit via Debit Card transaction. Once the card information is saved, it will show as linked debit card.</li>
	<li>Merchant can view linked debit cards in JazzCash Business App under My Account option as shown below:</li>
</ul>

<p style="margin-left:40px">JazzCash &gt;&gt; My Account &gt;&gt; Linked Cards &amp; Other Accounts</p>

<ul>
	<li>If multiple debit cards are linked, last used debit card will be set as default and will be used for next transactions.</li>
	<li>While performing deposit transaction via debit card, user can change default debit Card by clicking &ldquo;Change&rdquo; button before entering Amount.</li>
	<li>Debit card will be authorized by respective debit card issuer bank when it is used for the first-time during Deposit via Debit card transaction. Verification OTP will be sent on merchant&rsquo;s registered number at bank.</li>
	<li>Payment via debit card service is available in Split payment option for transactions which support Split payments. Example UBP, IBFT.</li>
	<li>Total transaction charge = service fee (3% of the deposited amount) + FED (Federal Excise Duty).</li>
	<li>FED is determined based on the province in which the merchant account is originally registered.</li>
	<li>For information on the tax percentages with respective provinces, please refer below:
	<ul>
		<li>Federal&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;16%</li>
		<li>Sindh&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; 13%</li>
		<li>Punjab&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; 16%</li>
		<li>KPK&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 15%</li>
		<li>Baluchistan&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;15%</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
	<li>&middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Example:
	<ul>
		<li>Deposit Amount = 1,000 Rs.</li>
		<li>Service fee = 3% of deposit Amount = 30 Rs.</li>
		<li>FED = 16% of Service fee = 16% of 30 Rs. = 4.8 Rs.</li>
		<li>Total Transaction charge = service fee + FED = 30 + 4.8 = 34.8Rs.</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
</ul>

<p>Table 1.0</p>

<table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Deposit via Debit Card </strong></p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Possible Value</strong></p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Channel</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>App</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Merchant Profile</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Jazz, OMNO</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Account Level</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>M0, M1, M2</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Platform Fee (USSD)</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>KMS &gt;&gt; Communication &gt;&gt; USSD Platform fee</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Platform Fee (App)</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>KMS &gt;&gt; Communication &gt;&gt; USSD Platform fee</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Minimum Deposit Amount</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>100 Rs.</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Maximum Deposit Amount</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>10,000 Rs.</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Service Fee</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>3% + FED of Deposit Amount</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>

<p><strong>System Navigation for Agent Action required/relevant in SOP: </strong></p>

<p>This section will cover step by step navigation of relevant system for required action by. E.g.</p>

<p><strong>Check Account Status:</strong> CPS &gt;&gt; Search MSISDN &gt;&gt; Check Status &gt;&gt; Active, Pending Active, Dormant</p>

<p><strong>Check Transaction History: </strong>CPS &gt;&gt; Search MSISDN &gt;&gt; Click Operations &gt;&gt; Click Info &gt;&gt; Click Transaction History &gt;&gt; Enter search criteria &gt;&gt; Click Search &gt;&gt; Transaction will be shown. &nbsp;</p>

<p><strong>Check Balance:</strong> CPS &gt;&gt; Search MSISDN &gt;&gt; Click Operations &gt;&gt; Click Info &gt;&gt; Click Account Info Tab &gt;&gt;Check Balance</p>

<p><strong>Check Verification from NADRA Portal: </strong>NADRA Portal &gt;&gt; Search MSISDN &gt;&gt; Enter CNIC and CNIC Issuance Date (ask from the merchant) &gt;&gt; Check Verification details</p>

ðŸ“‹ ENTRY: JazzCash â€“ Merchant â€“ Email Update
------------------------------------------------------------
Main Header: DFS
Network Provider: Jazz
Complaint Description: <ul>
	<li>This SOP document will cover scenarios related Account Email.</li>
	<li>Account Email is use to received Statement, alert about transaction and Important Updates regarding to your Account.</li>
	<li>Merchant can Email address via USSD and JazzCash Business App.</li>
	<li>From JazzCash Business App merchant can update email in Profile.</li>
	<li>You will receive real time Notification about transaction and other account activities carried out from account, helping you to stay informed about your account.</li>
	<li>Merchant can get account statement via email.</li>
	<li>If the merchant already added their email to their account profile, the statement will be sent on that email.</li>
	<li>Agent will inform merchant the complete How &ndash; to Processes and sent relevant ISMS. if merchant insists then agent will forward service request (Refer to Service Request Scenario)</li>
	<li>Please refer to below table 1.0 for high level product details.</li>

ðŸ“‹ ENTRY: JazzCash â€“ Merchant â€“ Utility Bill Payment 
------------------------------------------------------------
Main Header: DFS
Network Provider: Jazz
Complaint Description: <ul>
	<li>This SOP document will cover scenarios related Utility Bill</li>
	<li>Merchant can pay bills from JazzCash account via USSD and App.</li>
	<li>Merchant can pay all Utility Bills such as Electricity, Gas, Water, Telephone and Internet.</li>
	<li>Below are the UBP companies of which Merchant can pay bill</li>
</ul>

<table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Electricity</strong></p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Gas</strong></p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Water</strong></p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Telephone</strong></p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Internet</strong></p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>FESCO<br />
			GEPCO<br />
			HESCO<br />
			IESCO<br />
			K-ELECTRIC<br />
			LESCO<br />
			MEPCO<br />
			NIZAM ENERGY<br />
			PESCO<br />
			QESCO<br />
			SEPCOS</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>SNGL<br />
			SSGC</p>

			<p>&nbsp;</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>BWASA<br />
			FWASA<br />
			GWASA<br />
			HYDERABAD WASA<br />
			KWSB<br />
			LWASA<br />
			MWASA<br />
			PHED HARIPUR<br />
			RWASA<br />
			WSSC SWAT<br />
			WSSP</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>NAYATEL<br />
			OPTIX<br />
			PTCL EVO POSTPAID<br />
			PTCL EVO PREPAID<br />
			TRANSWORLD<br />
			WATEEN<br />
			WORLDCALL</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>PTCL LANDLINE<br />
			PTCL VFONE PREPAID</p>

			<p>&nbsp;</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
	</tbody>
</table>

<ul>
	<li>Merchant will select desired UBP Company and enter consumer number/reference number and fetch bill amount any pay it after entering MPIN bill will be paid.</li>
	<li>The maximum limit to pay utility bill via JazzCash is Rs. 100,000/month. This amount can be used either to pay one bill or several bills.</li>
	<li>For K-electric and PTCL complaint TAT will be 4 working days and for all other UBP company&rsquo;s complaint TAT will be 1 working Day</li>
	<li>Merchant can pay bill via app by entering Reference Number or Scanning Barcode.</li>
	<li>The scanner can be used to either scan a barcode through your phones camera or selecting an image from your gallery. Paying utility bills has never been this easy through your JazzCash Business app.</li>
	<li>Most of the electricity companies and gas companies allow for barcode scanning of their respective bills Refer to Table 1.1.</li>
</ul>

<p>Table 1.1</p>

<table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Electricity</strong></p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Gas</strong></p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>IESCO</p>

			<p>GEPCO</p>

			<p>PESCO</p>

			<p>QESCO</p>

			<p>HESCO</p>

			<p>SEPCO</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>SNGL<br />
			SSGC</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
	</tbody>
</table>

<ul>
	<li>For all UBP related issue agent must validate Merchant concern and ask Merchant UBP Reference number, Amount, Billing Company to ensure Merchant concern valid for complaint registration</li>
	<li>After validating Merchant concern and consulting system inform Merchant as per below scenarios.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Utility Bill Payment &ndash; Bill Paid against Wrong Reference Number:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>Merchant pay against wrong reference number agent will inform Merchant that bill is paid and no reversal is possible and inform Merchant to coordinate with relevant billing company.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Utility Bill Payment &ndash; Unable to Pay Bill:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>If Merchant is paying bill but is unable to pay bill due to any valid error agent will ask Merchant whether bill is received in hard copy or not.</li>
	<li>If bill is not received in hard copy agent will inform Merchant to wait for the bill to be received in hard copy</li>
	<li>If bill is received in hard copy agent will simply forward complaint (Refer to JazzCash &ndash; Merchant &ndash; Utility Bill &ndash; Complaint Management)</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Utility Bill Payment &ndash; 2-month Bill Paid </strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>If Merchant does not pay previous month bill and new bill is received with arrears and current bill is 2-month bill and Merchant is now paying 2-month bill if Merchant received bill in next month with arrears then complaint will be lodged (Refer to JazzCash &ndash; Merchant &ndash; Utility Bill &ndash; Complaint)</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Utility Bill Payment &ndash; Bill Paid in Due Date:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>If Merchant pay bill in due date and bill is received with arrears next month agent will forward complaint (Refer to JazzCash &ndash; Merchant &ndash; Utility Bill &ndash; Complaint)</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Utility Bill Payment &ndash; Amount Deducted Twice</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>If Merchant pay bill and amount is deducted twice inform Merchant that extra amount will be reversed within 24 hours.</li>
	<li>If amount is not reversed in 24 hours agent will forward complaint (Refer to JazzCash &ndash; Merchant &ndash; Utility Bill &ndash; Complaint).</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Utility Bill Payment &ndash; Amount Deducted More Than Bill Amount:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>If Merchant pay bill and amount paid is greater than bill amount informs Merchant that amount will be adjusted in next bill if not adjusted than proceed with complaint registration (Refer to JazzCash &ndash; Merchant &ndash; Utility Bill &ndash; Complaint)</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Utility Bill Payment &ndash; Bill Paid After Due Date:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>If Merchant pay bill late (after due date) and transaction is completed and Merchant is complaining that bill is not updated just inform Merchant to contact with relevant billing company.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Utility Bill Payment &ndash; Bill Paid Wrong by System Issue:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>If Merchant calls and say that he was paying current month bill but previous month bill got paid by system issue agent will inform Merchant that bill amount will be adjusted in next month bill.</li>
	<li>If next month bill is received without adjustment agent will forward complaint registration (Refer to JazzCash &ndash; Merchant &ndash; Utility Bill &ndash; Complaint)</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Utility Bill Payment &ndash; Bill Paid Against Two Channel:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>If Merchant pay bill from any other bank and same bill is paid again from JazzCash, agent will just inform Merchant that the bill will be adjusted in next month bill</li>
	<li>If Merchant wants adjustment right now then agent will inform Merchant to just contact relevant billing company.</li>
	<li>If next month bill is received without adjustment agent will forward complaint registration (Refer to JazzCash &ndash; Merchant &ndash; Utility Bill &ndash; Complaint)</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Proof of Utility Bill Payment: &nbsp;</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>Utility Bill was paid but the new bill showing arrears, and billing companies are asking for proof of utility bill payment via JazzCash.</li>
	<li>In case Merchant came with below complaint provide the below details (mentioned in table) to him/her on call in order to facilitate by checking CPS</li>
	<li>Agent need to request the Merchant to note down the details carefully and share that with UBP company
	<ul>
		<li>Receipt No: &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;</li>
		<li>Status: &nbsp;</li>
		<li>Date and time: &nbsp;</li>
		<li>Initiator: &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;</li>
		<li>Credit Party (which is utility bill company): &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;</li>
		<li>Amount Due &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;</li>
		<li>Amount Paid &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;</li>
		<li>Bill reference number</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Charges:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>Rs. 5.00 (Incl. Tax) per bill for first 3 bill</li>
	<li>Rs. 20.00 (Incl. Tax) per bill from 4th bill to 9th bill</li>
	<li>Rs. 30.00 (Incl. Tax) per bill from 10th bill to onward</li>
	<li>Charges as per calendar month</li>
	<li>Refer to Table 1.2 for high level understanding</li>
</ul>

<p>Table 1.2</p>

<table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Utility Bill Payment </strong></p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Values</strong></p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Channel</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>USSD, App</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Merchant Profile</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Jazz, OMNO</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Account Level</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>M0, M1, M2</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Platform Fee (App)</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>KMS &gt;&gt; Communication Tab &gt;&gt; App Platform fee</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Platform Fee (USSD)</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>KMS &gt;&gt; Communication Tab &gt;&gt; USSD Platform fee</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Service Fee</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Rs. 5 for first 3 bill</p>

			<p>Rs.20 from 4th to 9th Bill</p>

			<p>Rs.30 from 10th Bill to onward</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Account Status</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">

<p><strong>Pre-requisite to SOP</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>Verification: L3</li>
	<li>Account status: Active</li>
	<li>Need to validate Billing Company and Bill Reference Number</li>
	<li>Data to be taken from CPS only</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>System Navigation:</strong></p>

<p><strong>Check Account Status</strong>: CPS &gt;&gt; Search MSISDN &gt;&gt; Check Status</p>

<p><strong>Check Transaction History: </strong>CPS &gt;&gt; Search MSISDN &gt;&gt; Click Review Transaction &gt;&gt; Click Transaction</p>

<p><strong>Check Transaction Status: </strong>CPS &gt;&gt; Search MSISDN &gt;&gt; Click Review Transaction &gt;&gt; Click Transaction &gt;&gt; Search transaction as per Date/Time &gt;&gt; Check Status</p>

<p><strong>Check Verification from NADRA Portal</strong>: NADRA Portal &gt;&gt; Search MSISDN &gt;&gt; Enter CNIC and CNIC Issuance Date (Verify from Merchant) &gt;&gt; Check Verification details</p>

ðŸ“‹ ENTRY: JazzCash â€“ Customer â€“ Change of MSISDN 
------------------------------------------------------------
Main Header: DFS
Network Provider: Jazz
Complaint Description: <ul>
	<li>This SOP document will cover scenarios related to Change of MSISDN.</li>
	<li>Change of MSISDN is the process in which JazzCash Account number can be change from one number to another.</li>
	<li>Customer will visit any Jazz office (Experience Center, Franchise, Retailer) along CNIC number for Change of MSISDN.</li>
	<li>Change of MSISDN is available for customer profile only</li>
	<li>Account Level will remain same after change of MSISDN</li>
	<li>JazzCash account must be in active state otherwise if account is not active such as (Pending active, Dormant, Frozen and suspended) change of MSISDN cannot be processed.</li>
	<li>Customer would not be able to process Change of MSISDN through BVS, in case if Change of MSISDN was already processed with in last 60 days</li>
	<li>Change of MSISDN-BVS request will not processed from system level if customer have balance of Rs 100 or greater in his Jazz cash account</li>
	<li>Customer account balance should be less than Rs.100 for Change of MSISDN.</li>
	<li>The SIM card on which the MSISDN change is requested must be registered in the customer&#39;s name.</li>
	<li>RAAST ID shouldn&#39;t be linked to the account.</li>
	<li>The ready cash loan must be fully paid, and no outstanding balance should remain with the account.</li>
	<li>When change of MSISDN is performed customer account will change in Realtime on new MSISDN</li>
	<li>Next Gen account can also perform Change of MSISDN with guardian assistance.</li>
	<li>Agent will inform Next Gen account holder to visit retailer, franchise or experience center with guardian to perform Change of MSISDN.</li>
	<li>All limitations apply on next gen account to perform change of MSISDN (Refer to Table 1.0)</li>
	<li>Customer can also use his existing debit card (Master/Pakpak/Visa), after performing change of MSISDN.</li>
	<li>Customer can also use his existing MPIN after change of MSISDN.</li>
	<li>Refer to Table 1.0 for high level understanding.</li>
</ul>

<p>Table 1.0</p>

<table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
	<tbody>
		<tr>

ðŸ“‹ ENTRY: JazzCash â€“ Customer â€“ Credit Card Bill Payment 
------------------------------------------------------------
Main Header: DFS
Network Provider: Jazz
Complaint Description: <ul>
	<li>This SOP document will cover scenarios related to Credit Card Bill Payment</li>
	<li>A credit card is a type of facility, provided by banks that allow customers to borrow funds within a pre-approved credit limit.</li>
	<li>It enables customers to make purchase transactions on goods and services.</li>
	<li>Customer can now easily pay their Credit Card Bill via JazzCash App.</li>
	<li>Customer can pay 1 link Credit Card Bill Payments</li>
	<li>There is no upper and lower limit for bill payment</li>
	<li>Please refer to table 1.0 for high level understanding</li>
</ul>

ðŸ“‹ ENTRY: JazzCash â€“ Customer â€“ FWO M-Tag 
------------------------------------------------------------
Main Header: DFS
Network Provider: Jazz
Complaint Description: <ul>
	<li>This SOP document will cover scenarios related to M-Tag.</li>
	<li>JazzCash has partnered with FWO to offer M-Tag recharge solution for all travelers on M-2 motorway</li>
	<li>This project is a part of FWO&rsquo;s efforts to digitize all travels across country and M-2 (Lhr-Isb) is the pilot venture.</li>
	<li>At the moment, customers have to stop over close to major toll plazas at FWO customer centers to purchase and recharge their M-Tag.</li>
	<li>Customers will be able to recharge digitally via multiple mediums being offered by JazzCash.</li>
	<li>M-Tag is a RFID (Radio Frequency Identification) based Electronic Toll Collection Technology used on the Motorways of Pakistan.</li>
	<li>Customers will have following mediums available to top-up their M-tags:
	<ul>
		<li>JazzCash Mobile Account Via USSD menu</li>
		<li>JazzCash Retailer&rsquo;s network</li>
		<li>Smart Motorways App via Credit/Debit Cards &amp; JazzCash Mobile Account</li>
		<li>FWO Website via Credit/Debit Cards &amp; JazzCash Mobile Account</li>
		<li>(<a href="http://pakistansmartmotorways.com">http://pakistansmartmotorways.com</a>)</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
	<li>Customer will be charged Rs.20 including FED per FWO M-Tag recharge transaction</li>
	<li>Contact 1313 helpline at the Network Operations Center. of One Network for registering complaints and getting. information regarding M-Tag. National Highways &amp; Motorway Police-NHMP. Government of Pakistan FWO</li>
	<li>Please Refer to below table 1.0 for high level product details</li>
</ul>

<p>Table 1.0</p>

<table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>FWO M-Tag Transaction</strong></p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">

			<p>Rs. 20 Including FED</p>
			</td>
		</tr>

			<p>Active</p>

ðŸ“‹ ENTRY: JazzCash â€“ Customer â€“ Account Balance 
------------------------------------------------------------
Main Header: DFS
Network Provider: Jazz
Complaint Description: <p><strong>Product / Service Description: </strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>

<ul>
	<li>This process will cover all the information related to JazzCash Account Balance.</li>
	<li>Customer can easily check their account balance through USSD, JazzCash App and IVR.</li>
	<li>Customer will be charged 0.50 Rs. of checking account balance via USSD.</li>
	<li>Customer will be able to check account balance via app without any charges.</li>
	<li>Call setup charges for 4444 IVR is 0.75 Rs and 0.25 Rs will be charged to check balance from IVR.</li>
	<li>If customer calls on helpline and inquire about account balance, inform customer the account balance as per CPS after verification and send Balance Check ISMS for future reference.</li>
	<li>For Suspend or Frozen Account, agent will not inform account balance and will manage customer as per Account Activation process.</li>
	<li>Customer can also check account balance via Account statement. Customer can get their account statement through email via JazzCash App and USSD. Account statement will contain transaction details and available balance. Please refer to Account statement SOP.</li>
	<li>Every account level has specific limit to maintain balance. This maximum balance maintenance limit is as per customer account level as shown below.</li>
</ul>

<table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Account Level</strong></p>

			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Maximum Balance (Rs.)</strong></p>
			</td>
		</tr>

ðŸ“‹ ENTRY: JazzCash â€“ Customer â€“ Unikrew 
------------------------------------------------------------
Main Header: DFS
Network Provider: Jazz
Complaint Description: <p><strong>Product / Service Description: </strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>

<ul>
	<li>Customer Unikrew is an in App BVS feature by which customer can upgrade/activate/increase limit account in app.
	<ul>
		<li>Customer can open L1 account directly</li>
		<li>Customer can upgrade account from L0 to L1 (Limit Increase as well)</li>
		<li>Customer account dormant due to non usage of last 180 days can be activated.</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
	<li>Customer need to allow permission of JazzCash App from mobile app setting such as (Camera).&nbsp;</li>
	<li>If any of the above service customer want firstly agent will inform the customer of unikrew process</li>
	<li>Customer Unikrew is available for the android version of the Consumer app</li>
	<li>Customer can perform in JazzCash App BVS by scanning both hands.</li>
	<li>Customer will scan first left hand than right hand.</li>
	<li>A customer can do the biometric verification 3 times in a day this is inclusive of registration and normal upgrading.</li>
	<li>After 3 times, a customer can have their biometric verification done via the App after 24 hours have passed.</li>
	<li>Customer account limit and account level will increase from L0 to L1 through in App BVS (Unikrew). Limit/Level will increase within 5 minutes.</li>
	<li>Customer account dormant will be activated through in App BVS(Unikrew) within 5 minutes &nbsp;</li>
</ul>

<p>Table 1.0</p>

<table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

Important Points: <ul>
	<li>If a CNIC and fingerprints being scanned do not match the verification would not be successful and an error would be seen by the customer</li>
	<li>Therefore, the CNIC being entered for account registration should have the same details as per the fingerprints and details of a customer at NADRA side for the verification to be done</li>
</ul>

ðŸ“‹ ENTRY: JazzCash â€“ Customer â€“ Jazz Load 
------------------------------------------------------------
Main Header: DFS
Network Provider: Jazz
Complaint Description: <ul>
	<li>Customer can purchase Mobile Load (top-up) for any prepaid Jazz mobile number using JazzCash App and USSD.</li>
	<li>The service is available for all JazzCash mobile account users.</li>
	<li>Customer can purchase load for any prepaid Jazz number (Including Port-in numbers).</li>
	<li>Jazz Load minimum Limit for USSD: Rs.49.</li>
	<li>Jazz Load Maximum Limit for USSD: Rs.2000</li>
	<li>Jazz Load minimum Limit for consumer App: Rs.100.</li>
	<li>Jazz Load Maximum Limit for Consumer App: Rs.5000</li>
	<li>Customer JazzCash account balance has to be greater than Jazz Load amount + Platform fee.</li>
	<li>If Customer is availing Jazz Advance Service, Customers will not be able to purchase Jazz Load for amount that is less than the Jazz Advance amount taken. Need to perform load more than Jazz advance + Tax.</li>
	<li>Please refer to table 1.0 for high level understanding</li>
</ul>

<p>Table 1.0</p>

<table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Jazz Load Transaction </strong></p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Values</strong></p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Channel</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>App</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Customer Profile</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Jazz, OMNO</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Account Level</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>L0, L1, L2, ADA</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Platform Fee (App)</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>KMS <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> Communication Tab <strong>&gt;&gt;</strong> App Platform fee</p>

ðŸ“‹ ENTRY: JazzCash â€“ Customer â€“ Deposit Money/Cash-In 
------------------------------------------------------------
Main Header: DFS
Network Provider: Jazz
Complaint Description: <ul>
	<li>This SOP document will cover scenarios related Customer Cash-In/Cash deposit.</li>
	<li>Customer can get amount deposited in their account via Cash-In transaction from retailer, franchise and Jazz experience center.</li>
	<li>Customer can deposit maximum of Rs. 50,000 as Cash-In per transaction through retailer, franchise and Jazz experience Centre.</li>
	<li>Customer can get multiple Rs. 50,000 deposits via Cash-In transaction according to their respective account limit.</li>
	<li>Funds deposited by the customer will be instantly credited to their account.</li>
	<li>Customer having L0 account cannot deposit amount using Cash-In transaction without upgrading their account to L1. However, they can get funds via C2C or IBFT in their account.</li>
	<li>L0 customer can visit retailer (BVS), franchise or Jazz experience center to get their account upgraded/BVS verified. Once the account is upgraded to L1, customer can get Cash-In from any medium afterwards.</li>
	<li>If &nbsp;L0 customer calls and ask about Cash-In, in addition to cash-In information, inform customer the complete process of account migration. (Refer to Account migration SOP).</li>
	<li>Account must be in Active state. Cash-In cannot be done on suspended, frozen or dormant account.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</li>
	<li>For all How-to processes, inform customer to visit Retailer, Franchise and Experience Centre and also sent relevant ISMS of Retailer, Franchise and experience Centre address location and sent relevant ISMS.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Charges:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>Cash-In is a charged transaction. Customer will be charged according to deposited amount.</li>
	<li>From Amount Rs. 50 to 20,000, Fee will be 0.50% of amount + FED.</li>
	<li>From amount Rs. 20,001 and above, fee will be Rs. 100 flat + FED. &nbsp;</li>
	<li>Customer will be charged FED in accordance with government regulations.</li>
	<li>The province/city of retailer/franchise from where customer is getting Cash-In does not affect the tax calculation. Tax percentage is determined based on the province in which the customer&#39;s account was originally registered.</li>
	<li>The fee and tax will be deducted from the Cash-In amount, and the remaining balance will be deposited into the customer&#39;s account.</li>
	<li>For information on the tax percentages with respective provinces, please refer below:
	<ul>
		<li>Federal&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 16%</li>
		<li>Sindh&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 13%</li>
		<li>Punjab&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 16%</li>
		<li>KPK&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 15%</li>
		<li>Baluchistan&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 15%</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
	<li>Tax percentage is charged on the fee, not on the Cash-In amount.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Example:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>&nbsp;Example for Cash-In amount from Rs. 50 to Rs. 20,000
	<ul>
		<li>Cash-In amount = 1,000 Rs.</li>
		<li>City: Islamabad (Province = Federal)</li>
		<li>Service Fee = 0.50% of Cash-In Amount = 5 Rs.</li>
		<li>FED = 16% of Service Fee = 16% of 5 Rs. = 0.65 Rs.</li>
		<li>Total Cash-In Fee = Service fee + FED = 5 + 0.65 = 5.65 Rs.</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
	<li>Example for Cash-In amount greater than Rs. 20,001 and above.
	<ul>
		<li>Cash-In Amount = 30,000</li>
		<li>City: Karachi (Province = Sindh)</li>
		<li>Service Fee = Flat Rs. 100</li>
		<li>FED = 13% of Service Fee = 13% of 100 Rs. = 13 Rs.</li>
		<li>Total Cash-In Fee = Service Fee + FED = 100 + 13 = 113 Rs.</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
	<li>Please refer to below table 1.0 for high level product details.</li>
</ul>

<p>Table 1.0</p>

<table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>JazzCash Customer Cash-In</strong></p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Values</strong></p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>

			<p>L3</p>

			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Limitation (as per scenarios)</p>
			</td>

			<p>Customer account level L0 cannot perform Cash-In</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>T&amp;C</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>N/A</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Consultation Portal</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>CPS, Nadra</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
	</tbody>
</table>

------------------------------------------------------------
Main Header: DFS
Network Provider: Jazz
Complaint Description: <ul>
	<li>This SOP document will cover scenarios related Bachat Account.</li>
	<li>Customer can subscribe any saving plan to get profit on daily basis.</li>
	<li>Customer has to maintain minimum balance first to subscribe any saving plan.</li>
	<li>There are six types of Plan customer can subscribe via App and USSD</li>
</ul>

			</td>
			<td style="border-bottom:1px solid black; border-left:none; border-right:1px solid black; border-top:none; height:12px; vertical-align:bottom; width:217px">
			<p style="text-align:center"><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif"><span dir="ltr" lang="en-PK" style="font-size:12.0pt"><span style="color:black">Bachat Plan C</span></span></span></span></p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="border-bottom:1px solid black; border-left:1px solid black; border-right:1px solid black; border-top:none; height:12px; vertical-align:bottom; width:141px">
			<p style="text-align:center"><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif"><span dir="ltr" lang="en-PK" style="font-size:12.0pt"><span style="color:black">Advanced Savings</span></span></span></span></p>
			</td>
			<td style="border-bottom:1px solid black; border-left:none; border-right:1px solid black; border-top:none; height:12px; width:104px">
			<p style="text-align:center"><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif"><span dir="ltr" lang="en-PK" style="font-size:12.0pt"><span style="color:black">14%</span></span></span></span></p>
			</td>
			<td style="border-bottom:1px solid black; border-left:none; border-right:1px solid black; border-top:none; height:12px; width:113px">
			<p style="text-align:center"><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif"><span dir="ltr" lang="en-PK" style="font-size:12.0pt"><span style="color:black">100,000</span></span></span></span></p>
			</td>
			<td style="border-bottom:1px solid black; border-left:none; border-right:1px solid black; border-top:none; height:12px; vertical-align:bottom; width:217px">
			<p style="text-align:center"><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif"><span dir="ltr" lang="en-PK" style="font-size:12.0pt"><span style="color:black">Advanced Savings</span></span></span></span></p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="border-bottom:1px solid black; border-left:1px solid black; border-right:1px solid black; border-top:none; height:12px; vertical-align:bottom; width:141px">
			<p style="text-align:center"><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif"><span dir="ltr" lang="en-PK" style="font-size:12.0pt"><span style="color:black">Elite Savings</span></span></span></span></p>
			</td>
			<td style="border-bottom:1px solid black; border-left:none; border-right:1px solid black; border-top:none; height:12px; width:104px">
			<p style="text-align:center"><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif"><span dir="ltr" lang="en-PK" style="font-size:12.0pt"><span style="color:black">16%</span></span></span></span></p>
			</td>
			<td style="border-bottom:1px solid black; border-left:none; border-right:1px solid black; border-top:none; height:12px; width:113px">
			<p style="text-align:center"><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif"><span dir="ltr" lang="en-PK" style="font-size:12.0pt"><span style="color:black">250,000</span></span></span></span></p>
			</td>
			<td style="border-bottom:1px solid black; border-left:none; border-right:1px solid black; border-top:none; height:12px; vertical-align:bottom; width:217px">
			<p style="text-align:center"><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif"><span dir="ltr" lang="en-PK" style="font-size:12.0pt"><span style="color:black">Elite Savings</span></span></span></span></p>
			</td>
		</tr>
	</tbody>
</table>

<ul>
	<li>
	<p style="margin-left:48px">&nbsp;</p>
	</li>
	<li>The customer would be asked if they want to declare zakat</li>
	<li>Customer will select saving plan and profit will be added as per subscribed plan</li>
	<li>Subscribing is free, to get a daily profit disbursed the user will have to maintain the minimum balance (same as USSD)</li>
	<li>Customer will be charged with Withholding tax rates on saving plans:
	<ul style="list-style-type:disc">
		<li><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="background-color:white"><span style="color:#333333"><span style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif"><strong>Filer 15%</strong></span></span></span></span></li>
		<li><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="background-color:white"><span style="color:#333333"><span style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif"><strong>Non-Filer 30%</strong></span></span></span></span></li>
	</ul>
	</li>
</ul>

<ul>
	<li>Customer need to maintain the minimum balance to get profit on daily basis.</li>
	<li>If customer balance becomes less than the minimum balance, then profit will not be posted to the customer.</li>
	<li>Customer will be charged withholding tax on profit amount.</li>
	<li>For Filers customer will be charged 15% of profit amount.</li>
	<li>For Non-Filers customer will be charged 30% of profit amount.</li>
	<li>Customer subscribed Saving Plan then customer will not be posted With JazzCash Free minutes and SMS on balance maintenance.</li>
	<li>On subscribed saving plan zakat will be deducted from customer account</li>
	<li>Customer can exempt himself from zakat deduction simply by USSD (Refer to How to Processes 2.2)</li>
	<li>Zakat will be deducted for this year if his balance is equal or more than the current Nisab set.</li>
	<li>Zakat exemption must be submitted before 1st Shaban ul Moazzam. Exemption request received after 1st Shaban ul Moazzam will not be entertain for current year. However, if any account is opened on or after 1st of Shaban ul Moazam the Zakat declaration may be obtained while opening the account and condition of thirty days preceding the valuation date does not apply.</li>
	<li>Please refer to below table 1.0 for high level product details.</li>
</ul>

ðŸ“‹ ENTRY: JazzCash â€“ Customer â€“ Account Migration 
------------------------------------------------------------
Main Header: DFS
Network Provider: Jazz
Complaint Description: <ul>
	<li>This SOP document will cover scenarios related customer Account Migration</li>
	<li>Account migration refers to the process of transferring a customer&#39;s account from one type or level to another, often involving an upgrade to a higher limit or more feature-rich account.</li>
	<li>There are total of 4 levels of customer account in JazzCash. L0, L1, Asaan Digital Account and L2. Customer can migrate/upgrade their account from current level to above/next level account.</li>
	<li>After migrating successfully customer cannot reverse back to previous level.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Account Migration &ndash; from L0 to L1</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>L0 account is a basis, non-BVS verified account (with minimal limits) which can be opened using JazzCash USSD (*786#) or via JazzCash App.</li>
	<li>Customer can migrate from L0 account to L1 account via JazzCash app using Unikrew BVS functionality (refer to Customer Unikrew &ndash; SOP document), or by visiting nearest retailer/franchise where after providing BVS account will be upgraded to L1.&nbsp;</li>
	<li>Through JazzCash App, customer account will be migrated From L0 to L1 within 5 minutes.</li>
	<li>Through Retailer/Franchise, customer account will migrate from L0 to L1 in real-time after providing successful biometric verification.</li>
	<li>There are no charges on migrating account from L0 to L1.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Account Migration &ndash; From L1 to Asaan Digital Account (ADA)</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>Customer can migrate his L1 account to ADA via JazzCash App (Refer to Asaan Digital Account SOP).</li>
	<li>Customer account will provide relevant information and submit migration request in JazzCash App. Request will be approved within 48 Hours and customer account will be upgraded. Migration charges to Asaan Digital Account is Rs: 100.</li>
	<li>Only L1 account can be migrated to Asaan Digital Account.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Account Migration &ndash; From L1 or ADA to L2</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>For L2 Migration, customer need to visit MMBL with supportive documents such as Original CNIC and CNIC Copy, Source of income and visiting card.</li>
	<li>There are no charges on migrating to L2 account.</li>
	<li>Once L2 migration request is submitted, customer account will be migrated within 3 working days.</li>
	<li>Customer cannot migrate account from L0 to L2 directly.</li>
</ul>

<p><strong>Account Migration &ndash; From NextGen L0 Account to L1</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>NextGen Account (Minor Account) can be migrated to L1 account through BVS or JazzCash App (refer to NextGen Account - SOP).</li>
	<li>Next Gen Account cannot migrate to ADA account or L2 account.&nbsp;</li>
	<li>Please refer to below table 1.0 for high level product details.</li>
</ul>

<table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width:558px">
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Account Migration</strong></p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Values</strong></p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">

			<p>N/A</p>
			</td>
		</tr>

			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Consultation Portal</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>CPS, NADRA</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
	</tbody>

</ul>

ðŸ“‹ ENTRY: JazzCash â€“ Customer â€“ Asaan Digital Account 
------------------------------------------------------------
Main Header: DFS
Network Provider: Jazz
Complaint Description: <ul>
	<li>This SOP document will cover scenarios related Asaan Digital Account (ADA).</li>
	<li>Asaan Digital Account is a State Bank&rsquo;s initiative where customers upgrade their L1 account to Asaan Digital Account which has higher limits.</li>
	<li>Asaan Digital Account is only applicable on Rule Profile of L1 Account, means customer must be a Biometrically verified L1 account holders to be able to upgrade to Asaan Digital Account.</li>
	<li>After successful migration to Asaan Digital Account, customer cannot reverse back to L1 account level.</li>
	<li>Assan Digital Account is not applicable on Minor Account.&nbsp;</li>
	<li>Customer can upgrade L1 JazzCash account to Asaan Digital Account through JazzCash App.</li>
	<li>Asaan Digital Account upgradation charges are Rs:100.</li>
	<li>Rs:100 charges on upgrading account are non-refundable.&nbsp;</li>
	<li>Geo-Location must be enabled by the user. This is SBP requirement so that user outside Pakistan cannot upgrade the account.</li>
	<li>For both Jazz as well as OMNO users, SIM ownership should be on the JazzCash Account holder name.</li>
	<li>Assan Digital Account migration will be completed within 48 hours after request submitted</li>
	<li>Asaan Digital Account is the upgrade of L1 customer account with higher limits.</li>
</ul>

<table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Transaction type</strong></p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Limits</strong></p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Daily Debit/Credit</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>400,000</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Monthly Debit/Credit</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>1,000,000</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Yearly Debit/Credit</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>12,000,000</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
	</tbody>
</table>

<ul>
	<li>Rs: 1,000,000 is the maximum balance customer can keep in his account.</li>
	<li>Asaan Digital Account limit for C2C are:</li>
</ul>

<table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Transaction type</strong></p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p style="text-align:center"><strong>Limits</strong></p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Daily Debit/Credit</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>400,000</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Weekly Debit/Credit</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>1,000,000</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Monthly Debit/Credit</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>1,000,000</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>Yearly Debit/Credit</p>
			</td>
			<td style="vertical-align:top">
			<p>12,000,000</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
	</tbody>
</table>

<ul>
	<li>C2C transaction counter (per transaction) of 5 debit and 5 credit transactions are applicable only on daily transactions. (counter is not application on weekly, monthly or yearly transactions).</li>
	<li>Asaan Digital Account can be upgraded to L2 account (Refer to Account Migration SOP).</li>
	<li>Following Personal information is required in App for Asaan Digital Account Upgradation;
	<ul>
		<li>Full Name (This will be Auto populated by CPS. Customer cannot change it)</li>
		<li>Father/Spouse/Guardian Name</li>
		<li>Gender (Select gender).</li>
		<li>Contact Number (This will be Auto populated by CPS. Customer cannot change it).</li>
		<li>CNIC Expiry Date</li>
		<li>Email Address (will be auto populated if already provided by user at L1 account customer).</li>
		<li>Occupation (From drop down list. Sample doctor/Nurse/teacher, Other etc).</li>
		<li>Purpose of Account (from drop down list. Sample salary/Saving/Remittance/Other).</li>
		<li>Source of Income (From drop down list. Salaried/business/other).</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
	<li>Following Professional Information is required in App for Asaan Digital Account Upgradation.
	<ul>
		<li>Are you a Tax resident of USA? (Addition Information required if selected)</li>
		<li>Are you a Tax resident other than USA? (Addition Information required if selected)</li>
		<li>Are you a Tax resident of Pakistan?</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
	<li>Please refer to below table 1.0 for high level product details.</li>
</ul>
